</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Enables/Disables the person's fatigue.  </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unit '''enableFatigue''' enable </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> enable: [[Boolean]]  </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>{ _x [[enableFatigue]] [[false]]; } [[forEach]] ([[units]] [[group]] [[player]]);</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on March 24, 2015 - 16:30 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Harmdhast|Harmdhast]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
When the player dies enableFatigue is set to true after the respawn
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes -->
</comment>
<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 27, 2016 - 19:17 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Pierre MGI|Pierre MGI]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
To precise the note of Harmdhast, this command is not persistent (after respawn). So, in MP, you'll have to enableFatigue false, also in onPlayerRespawn.sqf or through the MP eventHandler  MPRespawn.
</dd>
</dl>
